generation: Metformin is the first line treatment for type 2 diabetes.
Lifestyle modification including diet and exercise is recommended for managing type 2 diabetes.
Insulin therapy may be required in advanced type 2 diabetes.
Metformin improves insulin sensitivity and reduces hepatic glucose production.
ACE inhibitors and ARBs should always be combined.
Insulin is never used for type 2 diabetes.
Diabetes can always be cured permanently with lifestyle changes.
Type 2 diabetes has no long-term complications if treated.
